answers.answer: You really require an in-person evaluation by an M.D. There are several possible etiologies. Rule-out-diabetes. Rule-out-cellulitis. The answer is yes, you should see a physician.

question: I am a 59 year old woman. Health problems are slight high blood pressure and a little overweight(doing weight watchers presently) I eat healthy , sleep 7 hours nightly, walk some for exercise.Last night I had some pain in the front of my right leg, no injury..just pain.  I had trouble sleeping, burning painful sensation on front of leg.  This morning my leg is tingling, burning, hurts if I touch it..just uncomfortable.  Should I see a doctor?  What could this be?
title: Burning tingling pain front of lower leg
